revised_title: Absolute Measure of Thermal Radiation in Conductors
tldr: The author conducted experiments to determine the loss of heat from the surface of electrically conducting wires in various conditions. They tested the Stefan's law, which states that radiation of heat is proportional to the fourth power of the absolute temperature of the radiating surface. The author's method involved measuring the electric current, resistance, and dimensions of the wire to calculate the loss of heat per square centimeter.
